str2: And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To speak freely, boldly; To be confident.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From sunago; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish 'synagogue'; by analogy, a Christian church.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Diminutive of Priska; Priscilla, a Christian woman.
And, even, also, namely.
Probably for Latin aquila; Akulas, an Israelite.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I take to myself, (b) I take aside, (c) I welcome. From pros and lambano; to take to oneself, i.e. Use, lead, admit.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From ek and tithemi; to expose; figuratively, to declare.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Carefully, exactly, strictly, distinctly. Adverb from the same as akribestatos; exactly.
